title: Title page in T: The New York Times Style Magazine
content:
The issue was from this year (I think). See the image below. It seems to be a mix of condensed and regular unless the designers manually adjusted the type. Any help appreciated, thanks!

**Solved** : [https://commercialtype.com/news/updates/schnyder\_for\_t](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317060403/https:/commercialtype.com/news/updates/schnyder_for_t "https://commercialtype.com/news/updates/schnyder\_for\_t")

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317060403im_/http:/typophile.com/files/the-place-for-kime_4903.jpg)

Font: 

 Schnyder 

Solved By: 

 [Ryuk](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317060403/http:/typophile.com/user/22675 "View user profile.")
author: davidyeiser

comments.content: [Schnyder](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317060403/http:/commercialtype.com/news/updates/schnyder_for_t), bespoke typeface by Commercial Type designers Berton Hasebe and Christian Schwartz, exclusive for The New York Times style Magazine T
